params._depthDiff: the minimal depth diff to validate sidechain block
params._sidechainBlockNumber: the sidechain block number to validate

returns._0: bool is the sidechain block valid
returns._1: address the producer of the sidechain block

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

produceBlock(uint256).details: this function can only be called by a worker, user never calls it directly

produceBlock(uint32,bytes).details: this function can only be called by a worker, user never calls it directly

params._data: the data to store in the block
params._parent: the parent block that current block appends to

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

returns._0: uint256 mainchain block number when the user can produce a sidechain block

canProduceBlock(address).notice: Check if address is allowed to produce block

getEthBlockStamp().notice: Get mainchain block number of last sidechain block

getLastProducer().notice: Get the producer of last sidechain block

produceBlock(uint256).notice: Produce a block in V1 chains

produceBlock(uint32,bytes).notice: Produce a block in V2 chains

whenCanProduceBlock(address).notice: Get when _user is allowed to produce a sidechain block
